alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County; Kit Carson County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued April 11 at 10:06PM MDT until April 12 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 7 PM MDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Southwest winds turn northwest with speeds of 30 to 40 mph and gusts up to 60 mph expected. * WHERE...Cheyenne and Kit Carson Counties. * WHEN...From 11 AM to 7 PM MDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Dangerous travel conditions are expected, especially on major routes such as Interstate 70 and Highway 385. Wind of this magnitude may down trees, power lines, and damage property in addition to producing areas of blowing dust that could result in localized diminished visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Southwest winds will shift to the northwest between the late morning and early afternoon.
info.instruction: If you must drive, watch for objects blowing across the roadway and into your path. Keep a safe distance from cars in adjacent lanes as strong gusts could suddenly push a vehicle outside its lane of travel. Take extra care in high-profile vehicles such as a truck, van, or SUV, or when towing a trailer, as these are more prone to be pushed or even flipped by high winds.
